page.title: 09TUNSTEAD QUARRY:JOBS
page.content: There are about{600 workers}at Tunstead Quarry, plus the lorry drivers and a few Youth Training Scheme students.{Ten years ago, they {employed over 1000 people.}The workforce has changed because of the introduction of {modern technology: {computers etc..}They intend to keep the same number of workers in the future. The wages of the employees range from Â£60-Â£400 per week. The workers in the quarry include blasters,shovel and dumper truck drivers, crusher operators, processing staff, kiln operators, mechanics, welders, electricians, masons, and joiners. In addition to these, there are office staff, including managers, secretaries, draughtsmen, engineers, chemists and computer operators.
